title: Support cover list for non-status lists
description: Allow cover list to fetch lists like "Owned" or "Bad Smart People" that are not status-based.
notes:
Status: in_progress.

Context: cover list currently resolves status names (reading/toread/read) in cmd/list.go: displaySpecificList -> getStatusID(listName), else scans user lists (GetUserLists) and fetches list by ID (GetListBooks). This already supports custom list names, but may not support non-status lists like Owned/Bad Smart People due to API differences (these appear as special lists, possibly not returned by me{lists} or list_books).

Files reviewed:
- cmd/list.go (displaySpecificList, displayAllLists)
- internal/api/hardcover.go (GetUserLists, GetListBooks, GetUserBooks)
- cmd/list_test.go (custom list test uses lists + lists_by_pk mocks)
- docs/hardcover-api/GraphQL/Schemas/Lists.mdx (list schema + queries)
- docs/hardcover-api/GraphQL/Schemas/Books.mdx (list_books query for user collection)
- docs/hardcover-api/GraphQL/Schemas/Activities.mdx (List Activity example shows Owned list path @user/lists/owned)
- fixtures/schema (lists fields include url, object_type, ranked, featured, privacy_setting_id, etc)

Open questions / likely fix:
- Owned list may not be a user-created list; might be a special list or list_books derived from user_books owned flag or tags. In schema, user_books has "owned" field (bool) but no tags relation. lists type supports url/path/featured/etc. Might need separate query for special lists or use list_books with filters.
- Determine GraphQL query to fetch non-status list by name/path/slug. Possibly query lists(where: {name: {_ilike: ...}, user_id: {_eq: me.id}}) instead of me{lists}? Note: users.lists has no args in schema, so me{lists} may return only custom lists?

Next steps:
1) Identify GraphQL query that returns Owned/Bad Smart People from docs or schema. Maybe query lists(where: {name: {_ilike: ...}, user_id: {_eq: me.id}}) instead of me{lists}.
2) If non-status list is derived (Owned), consider query list_books with filters: user_books.owned == true (from schema: user_books has owned). Need to check if list_books exposes user_books relationship to filter.
3) Update GetUserLists/GetListBooks or add new client method for special lists.
4) Add tests in cmd/list_test.go for a non-status list name ("Owned"/"Bad Smart People") once API query known.

Note: python3 is available; python not found. bd commands run with warning about daemon slow start.
